SENT.plain: We report here an autopsy case of Binswanger's disease (BD) without hypertension and associated with cerebral infarction in the terminal stage
The female patient, who was 74 years old at the time of death, had initially demonstrated manic-depressive disorder-like mental disorder, followed by dementia and neurological deficits
A brain CT scan showed white matter low attenuation bilaterally and symmetrically
BD was clinically diagnosed despite the lack of hypertension
In the terminal stage, she suffered an infarction in the left anterior cerebral artery region, and died of pneumonia

Neuropathologically, we found the infarction of the left anterior cerebral artery region, demyelination, fibrillary gliosis, lacunae and arteriosclerosis of the small arteries and arterioles in the white matter
